result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel L Paschke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel L Paschke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samuel L Paschke in court, in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Defendant's continued waiver of right to Counsel, reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on how he wants to proceed. Defendant advises of miscommunication at jail, did not have time today to meet with DA Pelrine. ADA Korb advises of conversation with DA Pelrine regarding letter received from Defendant, answers questions from Defendant. Defendant has questions about plea questionnaire. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Samuel L Paschke in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State advises that Defendant is serving long-term sentence in jail, now has Huber, mailed settlement offer to Defendant, does not know if Defendant wants to accept offer. Defendant never received anything. State will provide copy of offer today, requests adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 14, 2016 at 10:45 am.
from Defendant requesting that cash bond be refunded since signature bond was set

Defendant Samuel L Paschke in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond set. State will be sending settlement offer to Defendant at jail.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 10:15 am.
